question.body: In congestive heart failure, the greater the venous return, the lower the stroke volume. This is because __________.

multiple_choice.choice: there is less blood flowing into the heart
the more blood flowing into the heart the less oxygen the myocytes will receive
the myofilaments of the myocytes are stretched beyond their optimal length
greater venous return increases the afterload excessively

response.feedback: Incorrect. There is more blood flowing into the heart with a greater venous return.
Incorrect. Although there is more blood flowing into the heart, this does not directly affect the coronary perfusion, which determines the amount of oxygen the myocytes receive.
Correct. The actin and myosin overlap decreases with greater dilation of the ventricles. This leads to less crossbridge formation and a lower force of contraction.
Incorrect. Afterload is the pressure the heart pumps into (for the left ventricle, this is aortic pressure), which is not significantly increased with an increase in venous return.
